title: About Me
summary: I built this 'resume website' to teach myself some React basics. Below is a little bit about me!
duties: I'm an avid reader who subscribes to James Wood's notion that fiction is the art of 'serious noticing,' or deep attentiveness to language, the world, and human behavior. The last book I loved was 'The Transit of Venus' by Shirley Hazzard. I don't love nonfiction business books and prefer to drink from the firehose of insight on Substack, Twitter, blogs, etc.

I was born in Boston, grew up in the Philly suburbs, and chose to live in Philadelphia and New York as an adult, so I'm a 'northeast corridor' guy through-and-through. Moving to NYC transformed my life and I love the city a corny amount and expect to die here (so, I'm not open to relocation). On sunny Sundays I bike around joyfully and aimlessly, and during the week I play in a few social sports leagues (Skee-Ball and beach volleyball).

I am 'crypto-curious,' but try to keep my feet on the ground. My first true exposure to the space was in 2015, when I discovered Augur (and Ethereum) while researching prediction markets. Dozens of ICOs, DAOs, CryptoKitties, and DeFi (mis)adventures later, I remain optimistic about the potential of this technology, but practical about the tradeoffs and utility of using a blockchain.
